# About me
My name is Yimeng Shang, now a second-year Ph.D. student in biostatistics in [Penn State University](https://med.psu.edu/biostatistics-phd). I got my Master's degree in the Mailman School of Public Health in [Columbia University in the city of New York](https://www.columbia.edu/). 

I'm interested in analyzing high-dimensional data. My research mainly involves using <b>machine learning methods</b> to improve <b>causal inference</b> specifically we are now developing variable selection methods for propensity score model using <b>MarketScan EHR data</b>.

I took courses in Biostatistical method, Probability, Statistical Inference, Causal Inference, Data Science, Clinical Trial Methodology, Survival Analysis, Epidemiology, Adcanced Statistical Computing, Machine Learning and Data Mining.

Learn more from [here](aboutme.html) and from my [resume](curriculum_vitae.pdf).
